com.ace.lewissketch
Class Graph

java.lang.Object
  com.ace.lewissketch.Graph
All Implemented Interfaces:
LsConstants
 class Graph
extends Object
implements LsConstants

Combines on-screen and off-screen graphics objects and mimics needed Java standard Graphics class methods, applying all invocations to both (on and off) actual graphics objects.

Field Summary
private  Graphics offScreenGraphics
          The graphics of the image of the applet.

          The graphics of the applet.

stripeTriangle

void stripeTriangle(int[] vertex,
                    int[] basePt1,
                    int[] basePt2)
Draws an isosceles triangle with stripes. We get a series of evenly spaced points along the two equal sides of an isosceles triangle. We draw a line from every point on one side to every point on the other.

Parameters:
vertex - coordinates of the unique vertex of the triangle
basePt1 - coordinates of one of the endpoints of the triangle's base
basePt2 - coordinates of one of the endpoints of the triangle's base

drawZigzag

void drawZigzag(int[] vertex,
                int[] basePt1,
                int[] basePt2)
Draws a zigzag line inside an isosceles triangle. We get a series of evenly spaced points along the two equal sides of an isosceles triangle. We draw a line from every even point on one side to every odd point on the other.

Parameters:
vertex - coordinates of the unique vertex of the triangle
basePt1 - coordinates of one of the endpoints of the triangle's base
basePt2 - coordinates of one of the endpoints of the triangle's base

getSidesPts

private List<ArrayList<int[]>> getSidesPts(int[] vertex,
                                           int[] basePt1,
                                           int[] basePt2,
                                           int ptSep)
Gets a series of evenly spaced points along the two equal sides of an isosceles triangle.

Parameters:
vertex - coordinates of the unique vertex of the triangle
basePt1 - coordinates of one of the endpoints of the triangle's base
basePt2 - coordinates of one of the endpoints of the triangle's base
ptSep - number of pixels separating each point
Returns:
two series of x,y coordinates of points along the triangle's two equal sides
